page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION
page.content:
This block contains the{Gorey}and {Faldouet}areas of Jersey. Gorey (or Gouray) is dominated by the famous medieval{Mont Orgueil Castle,}with a harbour at its base, and situated in the Parish of St.Martin. About one km. to the south is{Gorey Village,}in the Parish of Grouville, mainly built in the 19th. century to service the oyster-fishery and shipyards of that time, and adjoining{Grouville Golf {Links.}The whole coastal area is now tourism-orientated.
The inland area is almost entirely taken up with arable farming, and the steep hillsides have a reputation for producing some of the earliest crops of potatoes, Jersey's principal export.
